subject: Re: [junit] Unit Testing JPD's (Weblogic Java Process Definitions)
msgSnippet: ... You can test /any/ Java code with JUnit, so the answer to your question is yes . Still, there might be better ways to test JPDs in particular. I don t
messageBody:
Ritch Linklater wrote:

> Does anyone know if JUNIT supports this or if there is another tool
> out there that might?

You can test /any/ Java code with JUnit, so the answer to your question
is "yes". Still, there might be better ways to test JPDs in particular.
I don't know them, so I can't tell you what those are, but if you try,
then send us your questions, I'm sure we'll be able to figure it out
together.

At a minimum, I imagine a JPD needs to be executed somehow with some
method call. Test that method call.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
